etymology.description: 禾(禾) (hé, 'grain') + 刀(刀) (dāo, 'knife') = reaping grain with a knife -> advantage
etymology.interpretation: The character 利(利) (lì, 'advantage') symbolizes the act of cutting grain efficiently with a knife, which implies an advantage or benefit in harvesting.

examples.chinese: 正确的决定能带来意想不到的利(正確的決定能帶來意想不到的利)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngquè de juédìng néng dàilái yìxiǎngbùdào de lì.
examples.english: A correct decision can bring unexpected advantage.

examples.chinese: 团队协作能发挥各自优势带来的利(團隊協作能發揮各自優勢帶來的利)，互相支持更能增添合作的利(互相支持更能增添合作的利)。
examples.pinyin: Tuánduì xiézuò néng fāhuī gèzì yōushì dài lái de lì，hùxiāng zhīchí gèng néng zēngtiān hézuò de lì.
examples.english: Teamwork can leverage the advantages of each party, and mutual support can further enhance the benefits of cooperation.
